thread.title: Admirals can't hold off Orlando, drop 2nd in row
thread.title_full: Admirals can't hold off Orlando, drop 2nd in row | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: The Virginian-Pilot
title: Admirals can't hold off Orlando, drop 2nd in row
text:
ORLANDO, Fla. The Orlando Solar Bears scored three straight goals on two separate occasions Thursday night to earn a 6-3 victory over the Norfolk Admirals.
The Admirals scored first for the second consecutive night when Greg Chase knocked in a rebound at 2:02 of the first period.
That lead lasted just 1:08 before Chris Clapperton finished a rebound from between the circles.
Orlando pushed the lead to 3-1 on goals by Erik Faille and T.J. Foster.
The three unanswered goals ended Norfolk goalie Philippe Cadorette's first pro start with 9:38 left in the opening period.
The Admirals (1-3-0-0) tied the score on Michael Pelech's putback late in the first period and
Gabriel Verpaelst's unassisted goal late in the second.
But Orlando made it 4-3 on Patrick Watling's shorthanded goal. The Solar Bears added two empty-netters in the final minute.
The teams play again Saturday night.
Posted to : Admirals Sports
